list_definition.definition: to take care of; to look after
to be likely (to do something); to do (something) frequently

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: These plants tend to die in hot weather

list_definition.definition: to move, lean or slope in a certain direction

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This tree trunk tends to(wards) the left.

list_ex_of_english: The problem is that in focusing on an inherited internal mechanism, the role of learning over an organism's lifetime tends to get ignored.
Especially in less developed countries, research on ageing still tends to prejudge people's priorities and to focus narrowly on material outcomes.
The choice of a lower perspective in itself tends toward protest.
There is now powerful experimental evidence that this tends to promote and maintain cooperation.
What was clearer was that the range of opinion in the press tended increasingly to favour the government.
Most of the research reviewed in the preceding nine categories tends to favor the 2-gen over the 1-gen model.
The media agenda tends to become the common currency for discussion in the groups.
In the absence of such a detailed-and repeated-articulation, national security tends not to rise very high on the list of congressional priorities.
